opening.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the time when a new building, road etc is used for the first time, or when a public event begins, especially when it involves a special ceremony
opening.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the official opening of the new theatre

opening.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a hole or space in something
opening.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: a narrow opening in the fence
opening.translation[0].definitions[2].de: the beginning or first part of something
opening.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: at the opening of the trial
opening.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: There are very few openings in scientific research.
opening.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a chance for someone to do or say something
opening.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: His question left an opening for me to say exactly what I thought.
opening.translation[0].definitions[5].de: when something opens, or is opened
opening.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: I was startled by the sudden opening of the door.
opening.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: the opening match of the season
the opening chapter of the book
opening.translation[2].definitions[0].de: the beginning of a trading day on a financial market
opening.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: After a weak opening (=one with falling prices), Stockholm equities recovered to close mostly higher.
Oil and gasoline prices ended higher in moderate trading after a strong opening (=one with rising prices).
opening.translation[2].definitions[1].de: the time when a new business opens
opening.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: A number of celebrities attended the opening of his new restaurant.
opening.translation[2].definitions[2].de: when a country allows types of imports or foreign investment that it did not allow before, or when it allows more of these
opening.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: last year’s opening of the capital market to foreigners

opening.translation[2].definitions[3].de: a job or position that is available
